amendment.description: Amendment clarifies that State criteria for pathogens or pathogen indicators for coastal recreation waters must be as protective of human health as EPA's criteria; clarifies that the information database is intended to be information on exceedances of water quality standards in coastal recreation waters only; and clarifies the situation where EPA may implement a monitoring and notification program.
amendment.purpose: An amendment to clarify and make technical changes to specify that water quality criteria are as protective of human health as EPA criteria for pathogens and pathogen indicators; include Indian tribes in bill provisions; specify that EPA is authorized not mandated to make grants if appropriated funds are not available; clarify that the information database is for exceedances of standards for pathogens and that EPA need not implement a monitoring and notification program in states where they exist.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Boehlert amendment (A001) Agreed to by voice vote.
